title: Matt Hancock – 2018 Speech on the Creative Industries
author: admin
summary: Below is the text of the speech made by Matt Hancock, the Secretary of State for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport, at the third anniversary of the Creative Industries Federation on 9 January 2018.
content:
It’s fantastic to be here tonight; thank you to the Creative Industries Federation for inviting me this evening.
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence
  *[ABI]: Association of British Insurers
  *[CMU]: Capital Markets Union
  *[IMO]: International Maritime Organization
  *[MARPOL]: International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[IGF]: International Code of Safety for Ships using Gases or other Low-flashpoint Fuels
  *[COP]: Paris Climate Conference
  *[AOA]: The Airport Operators Association
  *[BATA]: British Air Transport Association

I’ve been privileged enough to start my new year with a new job and I’m delighted that this is my first speech as Secretary of State at DCMS.

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals

And what a fantastic place to do it, here at the Natural History Museum — featuring one of the world’s finest collections of artefacts, from the T-Rex to the woolly mammoth.

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
